Title: Internship & New Graduate Program 2020
FullDescriptions:
ABOUT US
Lark is the world's largest A.I. healthcare provider, servicing more than a million patients suffering from, or at risk of, chronic disease with A.I. Nurses. We're on a mission to improve people's health and happiness through our digital health coach. We are the only A.I. nurse ever to become fully medically reimbursed to 100% replace a live nurse because we achieved equivalent health outcomes to live healthcare professionals - which allows for infinitely scalable healthcare. Since launch Lark has continued to receive awards and accolades for both our product, and our leadership.

✦Apple's Top 10 Apps in the World
✧Business Insider's most innovative companies in the world along with Uber and Snapchat
✦Forbes-recognized CEO, listed as #1 in Top Ten Women in Tech

We are looking for a talented interns to join our growing team in Mountain View, CA, where you'll help build and scale the intelligent engine that is interpreting the world's health sensor data and empowering people to live fitter and happier lives.

Exciting opportunities with the team for internships and graduate roles below:

Data Analyst - Join an exciting team that is working on generating valuable insights based on user behavior.

On the Data team you will:

Support the team's ongoing efforts around data-driven decisions
Make sense of mass amounts of user behavior
Ensure ongoing collaboration between engineering, product, and data

Mobile Engineer - This team focusing on accessibility and increasing the quality of Lark's product! Bonus points if you love native mobile applications.

On the Mobile team you will:

Brainstorm solutions around product features
Own projects around the usability and quality improvements
Help optimize the product on both iOS and Android platforms

Backend Engineer - This exciting team is doing work around effective solutions for API scalability.

On the Backend team you will:

Ship robust, scalable code
Help develop API efficiencies
Increase reliability and usability of Lark's product
Exciting ownership of projects

Product - Work with a team working in nuanced behavior technologies. This role is likely to focus on tackling difficult UX issues.

On the Product team you will:

Develop User Insights and contribute to our behavior-changing technology
Create suggestions for improvement based on user data
Develop technology systems that support the product.
Work with content developers to add features or fix issues with the product.
Respond to product feedback requests from partners and users

Business Operations - Help Lark develop our business strategy, and jump in to help create streamlined, optimized operational efficiencies. This team requires analytical skills.

On the Business Operations team you will:

Support the team's ongoing strategic and market analysis efforts
Collaborate between departments internally to create smooth lines of communication
Draft proposals around efficiency improvements
Work with the team to implement optimizations

Why Lark?

Here's some information about the exciting projects our prior interns completed:


Rewriting our app from Objective-C to react native
Building core backend features (internal notification system, push notification logic)
Performance engineering/optimizations on backend
Contributing to development of a new, refactored backend

JOIN US
Our team works with cutting edge tools and technology related to Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. We are using NLP to process millions of meals, and accelerometer data to compute activity and sleep amounts from users' phones. Our chat AI is the most sophisticated digital health engagement tool in the world. Join us and make it even better!

Title: Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
About Enjoy

Enjoy is the next generation of retail. We pride ourselves on delivering a new kind of buying experience where our friendly Experts bring the best of the store directly to the door, along with personalized solutions, so you get the most out of your tech. We offer same-day delivery, setup and help for today's premiere mobile devices; pairing the convenience you'd get from shopping online with the confidence you'd get from a store, all in the comfort of your own home.

Enjoy is a fast-growing startup, currently operating in 50+ US locations and the U.K., with more expansion on the horizon. We're a mission-driven organization focused on bringing joy to people's lives while creating great jobs for a digital world. This requires a spirit of winning together and a strong growth mindset. We value people who choose kindness and are obsessed with delivering amazing experiences.

Enjoy is founded and led by Ron Johnson, former head of Apple Retail, along with an executive team from leading retail, technology, and design organizations, including: Apple, Facebook, Starbucks, Tesla, and Amazon.

About the role

This is a partner-facing role! As an Enjoy Data Analyst, you'll provide deeper analysis and valuable insights to unlock opportunities and drive informed business decisions. Evolve the data platform with user-friendly tools, solutions and dashboards so that relevant information can be efficiently gathered and easily interpreted by business teams. In addition to having strong data analytics background, an ideal candidate for this role should have experience coordinating with cross-functional business team, external partner teams, and ability to inspire confidence in data-driven decision making.

Responsibilities


Build trusted relationship with internal business teams and with external partner teams
This role is highly collaborative across all areas of the company: The partner account team, supply chain and logistics, engineering, creative, customer support, HR and Field
Partner with and align with leadership team, product managers, business teams and partners to set priorities based on analysis and results to implement and optimize business processes and solutions
Own data insights roadmap and deliverables by working with external partners and cross-functional business teams.
Collaborate with data team members to build and implement data solutions to help drive strategic business decisions leveraging insights, and iterate to drive bias to action
Effectively use data to tell stories, communicate key insights through internal reports, presentations and dashboards to drive business decisions
Lead business reviews meetings with leadership team and external partners
Evaluate and quantify the effect of experimentations and various tests through data analysis and statistical methods, and makes data-driven recommendations
Share weekly business performance with the partner teams and leadership team
Assist business teams in defining, tracking and optimizing processes, tools, and dashboards for better planning and management of the business
Helps analyze the effectiveness of new solutions to inform whether to double down, pivot, or eliminate a new feature or process
Goes above and beyond a specific problem to finding all possible explanations
Partners with data engineers/analysts to create consistency in analysis and reporting

Requirements


BS or MS in Engineering, Math, Statistics, Analytics, or Finance
3+ years of hands-on experience with SQL or python
5+ years working in a fast paced environment as a data analyst or data scientist.
Experience leading a team of data engineers/analysts, and working with teams located overseas, in different time zones
Excellent quantitative skills and a deep understanding of statistical methods, and an ability to inspire confidence in data-driven decision making
Experience working with data-warehouse, business intelligence technologies and databases
Experience with running A/B tests and familiar with experimentation platforms
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Attention to detail and ability to work with complex concepts and processes
Exhibit general curiosity to go deeper to understand business problems and surface interesting facts
Understanding of eCommerce and Retail will be a big plus
Open to travel to partner locations when necessary

Title: Contract Marketing Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.
Job Description
About the role


Arm architects the pervasive intelligence that is transforming our daily experience. Our chips and device architectures orchestrate the performance of the technology that makes modern life possible. For the past 25 years, we have been at the forefront of innovation in collaboration with our partners and customers bringing ground-breaking technology to market. Arm-based chips are integrated into millions of devices annually. Our vision is of increased purpose and meaning and we are growing to meet our vision of a secure, integrated and hyper-connected world.

We are seeking a hardworking Contract Marketing Data Analyst to join our team. If you’re the right person for this role, you know that analysis is just one step in a long journey. In the first stage, you’ll need to be fastidious in governing our data collection practices so that we have rich, meaningful, consistent prospect and customer data to work with. At the second stage, you know that analysis isn’t just about fishing out interesting insights; it’s about identifying which of many findings are the ones to focus on in order to drive more efficient processes, prioritize spending, and inevitably to enhance marketing’s contribution to sales pipeline.

Next stage? Set goals, track how your insights are translated into action, and report on how well we did. Last stage? Well … there is no last stage. You keep iterating and refining, always enthusiastically adapting to changing business landscapes and evolving goals. What does it all add up to? It’s no exaggeration that this is a unique opportunity to significantly contribute to the bottom line of one of the world’s largest and most successful technology leaders.

Be prepared to bring and discuss your case studies – examples of insights you derived from deep data analysis, how you presented your findings and translated them into actions, and the results achieved.

What will I be accountable for?


Drive a methodology for consistent data capture, cleansing and enrichment across our multiple CRM and automation platforms
You will work with other data analysts in sales and IT, develop a data dictionary that drives agreement across these functions about the format, meaning and metadata characteristics of key data points
Forge agreement on the key lead-to-win KPIs for marketing programs and translate these into strategic campaign and spending plans that deliver on targets for sales pipeline contribution
Create marketing KPI reports and dashboards and train and empower marketing and sales leaders to use them for basic business insight and “what if” explorations
Analyze the effectiveness of our lead scoring algorithms and, working with marketing and sales managers, refine our scoring methodology and thresholds to ensure the right volume of the best leads are being delivered to our global sales teams
Work with our global marketing managers to devise meaningful A/B and personalization tests, iterate and refine, and capture the conclusions to help build a Center of Excellence for marketing best practices
Cast an inquiring gaze across our entire data landscape to spot additional insights that can optimize marketing’s contribution to the business
This is a contract role with duration of 1 year commitment.
Job Requirements
What skills, experience and qualifications do I need?


This is a contract role with duration of 1 year commitment.
Local candidates or surrounding area of San Jose, CA only will be considered
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related discipline. MBA or Advanced degree in statistics is a plus
Minimum 5 years of experience in B2B high-tech marketing, with at least 4 years of focused experience as a marketing data analyst
Experience managing a customer data platform such as TreasureData or similar solutions
Experience with Salesforce reporting
Experience with visualization tools such as Chartio, Looker, or Tableau (and of course: Excel)
Must be articulate, persuasive and comfortable evangelizing insights and making concrete recommendations to peer and executive audiences in marketing and sales
Desired behaviors for this role:
At Arm, we are guided by our core beliefs that reflect our rare culture and guide our decisions, defining how we work together to defy ordinary and shape extraordinary:
We not I
Take daily responsibility to make the Global Arm community thrive
No individual owns the right answer. Brilliance is collective
Information is crucial, share it
Realize that we win when we collaborate — and that everyone misses out when we don’t
Passion for progress
Our differences are our strength. Widen and mix up your network of connections
Difficult things can take unexpected directions. Stick with it
Make feedback positive and expansive, not negative and narrow
The essence of progress is that it can’t stop. Grow with it and own your own progress
Be your brilliant self
Be quirky not egocentric
Recognize the power in saying ‘I don’t know’
Make trust our default position
Hold strong opinions lightly
#LI-JS1

Benefits
Your particular benefits package will depend on position and type of employment and may be subject to change. Your package will be confirmed on offer of employment. Arm’s benefits program provides permanent employees with the opportunity to stay innovative and healthy, ensure the wellness of their families, and create a positive working environment.

Annual Bonus Plan
Discretionary Cash Awards
401(k), 100% matching on first 6% eligible earnings
Medical, Dental & Vision, 100% coverage for employee only, shared cost for dependents
Basic Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance (AD&D)
Short Term (STD) and Long Term (LTD) Disability Insurance
Vacation, 20 days per year with option to buy 5 more.
Holidays, 13 days per year
Sabbatical, 20 paid days every four-years of service
Sick Leave, 7 days per year
Volunteering, four hours per month (TeamARM)
Office location dependent: café on site, fitness facilities, team and social events
Additional benefits include: Flexible Spending Accounts for health and dependent care, EAP, Health Advocate, Business Travel Accident Program & Commuter programs.
ARM, Inc. (USA) participates in E-Verify. For more information, please refer to www.dhs.gov/E-Verify
About Arm
Arm® technology is at the heart of a computing and connectivity revolution that is transforming the way people live and businesses operate. From the unmissable to the invisible; our advanced, energy-efficient processor designs are enabling the intelligence in 86 billion silicon chips and securely powering products from the sensor to the smartphone to the supercomputer. With more than 1,000 technology partners including the world’s most famous business and consumer brands, we are driving Arm innovation into all areas compute is happening inside the chip, the network and the cloud.

With offices around the world, Arm is a diverse community of dedicated, innovative and highly talented professionals. By enabling an inclusive, meritocratic and open workplace where all our people can grow and succeed, we encourage our people to share their unique contributions to Arm's success in the global marketplace.

About the office
The Arm San Jose office is nestled in California's Silicon Valley, just south of San Francisco. Serving as Arm’s North America headquarters, the office houses employees serving all divisions of Arm. World-renowned Stanford University is seen as a hub of innovation, helping to make San Jose one of the US’s fastest growing cities.

San Jose, California USA

Arm Inc.

Job Description
Data Analyst - Customer Care Center - Remote Opportunity
We are GDIT. The people supporting and securing some of the most complex government, defense, and intelligence projects across the country. We ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. Our work has meaning and impact on the world around us, but also on us, and that’s important.
GDIT is your place. You make it your own by embracing autonomy, seizing opportunity, and being trusted to deliver your best every day.
We think. We act. We deliver. There is no challenge we can’t turn into opportunity.
At GDIT, people are our differentiator.
General Dynamics Information Technology (GDIT) has an immediate need for a Data Analyst - Customer Care Center.

Create exception and outlier reports; develop trend analyses and alerts

Facilitate monthly user group meeting to provide instruction on use of MicroStrategy
Maintain task status using issue and project tracking software

Title: Business Analyst - Proofpoint Essentials
Qualifications:
Experience with/interest in learning data analysis/statistical analysis languages including (e.g. SQL, Python, R)
Experience automating/improving the performance of reporting systems to further automate routine tasks
Experience operating financial reporting/ERP/BI systems and working with engineering to define feature requests to improve the effectiveness of those solutions
FullDescriptions:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!
We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.
The Role
Proofpoint is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join our growing Industry Solutions team. In this role, you will focus on the Proofpoint Essentials platform, designed specifically for small and medium sized businesses. This role will play an integral part in Proofpoint’s fast-growing presence within the SMB space. You will be relied on daily, and collaborate with other members of the Industry Solutions team, as well as cross functional teams such as Product Management, Channel Sales and more. Your impact will include support of critical business forecasting, reporting and vendor relationship management as well as driving strategic analysis and supporting our channel partners and OEM relationships.
Your day-to-day
Develop and deliver monthly usage reports to all channel distributor/reseller/OEM partners
Develop and maintain holistic business intelligence models and dashboards for the Essentials product line, including Revenue (e.g. NARR, Renewals), Churn, Customer Satisfaction and User Engagement metrics
Manage channel distributor/reseller/OEM relationships with key Accounts Payable contacts within our channel; act as a liaison to our channel by raising invoicing questions to Proofpoint Product Management, Channel Account Managers and Finance teams to obtain resolution and vendor invoicing credits as required
Support channel partner requests to migrate accounts and customers as required
Develop monthly reports for executive review on the growth of the product, including key metrics
Research and deliver ad hoc reports on key strategic business considerations as required
Manage SLA claims process for channel partners
What you bring to the team
3 years of experience in a similar business analyst position that includes sales forecasting, reporting and/or vendor/partner billing and reporting.
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint and PowerBI or other BI visualization tools
Strong program management and analytical skills
Proactive attitude towards identifying opportunities and methods of systematizing routine analysis
Experience with/understanding of SaaS concepts and metrics including, ARR, Churn, MAU, DAU, stickiness, etc.
Inquisitive attitude towards data analysis, trend identification and ability to research root causes of customer data
Ability to work cross-functionally with key stakeholders in product management, sales, marketing, finance, legal and engineering
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with/interest in learning data analysis/statistical analysis languages including (e.g. SQL, Python, R)
Experience automating/improving the performance of reporting systems to further automate routine tasks
Experience operating financial reporting/ERP/BI systems and working with engineering to define feature requests to improve the effectiveness of those solutions
If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Title: SAP Analyst, General Ledger and Master Data Governance
Responsibilities:
Establish and lead working group meetings to understand as-is, identify gaps/propose improvements, evaluate solution alternatives, prioritize requirements, identify and design data, and drive consensus to achieve agreed set of requirements.
Stakeholder management, engagement and alignment critical for project success - including clearly communicating status, risks and remediation plans to executive stakeholders.
Resolve issues that arise for areas of responsibility keeping in mind impacts to the project timeline and to other programs/projects.
Communicate and interact with cross functional teams (tax, source-to-pay, Fixed Assets, Consolidations, International) on project plans to gather cross-functional requirements.
Partner with Finance leaders to deliver change management to ensure new processes and technology are deployed effectively and adopted by the organization.
FullDescriptions:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of relevant work experience.
Experience with SAP S/4 General Ledger, Master Data Governance (MDG), and how MDG works in a SAP environment.
Experience implementing process improvements. Experience with system implementations.

Preferred qualifications:

CPA/CA/MBA and/or Advanced Professional degree.
Experience with month-end close in a SAP environment.
Experience with BPC and BW.
Solid grasp of US GAAP principles.
Understanding of Consolidations and ASC 830 – Accounting for FX and operations in a multi-currency environment with multiple subsidiaries.
About the job
Google accountants are a savvy bunch who handle the core accounting responsibilities at Google. As a member of this team, you know your accounting principles and the full accounting process end to end. You'll advise on financial reports required by governmental regulations, and you'll review, analyze, and interpret financial and budgetary reports - and all this sounds like fun to you. Every day is a new challenge, and you're continually looking for ways to help our team get better at what we do, in the most efficient way possible. A team player at heart, you collaborate with our global team, advocate best practices and roll up your sleeves to pitch in when it's all hands on deck. You move fast while keeping your attention to detail, and you tap into your problem-solving skills to support Google's business objectives.
You will work closely with groups across Google, other Bets and Alphabet, leveraging your deep knowledge of Finance processes and system to develop solutions that meet our future business requirements.
You know how to work with Finance teams on complex projects in a matrix team structure to establish overarching strategy, goals and objectives, define requirements, design new business processes and data, structure and implement projects, and communicate status to stakeholders.
You understand execution risk and how to mitigate it and know effective change management is core to success. You're a role model for change and drive efforts with business teams to ensure planned benefits are delivered. You understand stakeholder management and are adept at managing relationships across a large and complex organization, and professional services partners.
The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
Responsibilities
Establish and lead working group meetings to understand as-is, identify gaps/propose improvements, evaluate solution alternatives, prioritize requirements, identify and design data, and drive consensus to achieve agreed set of requirements.
Stakeholder management, engagement and alignment critical for project success - including clearly communicating status, risks and remediation plans to executive stakeholders.
Resolve issues that arise for areas of responsibility keeping in mind impacts to the project timeline and to other programs/projects.
Communicate and interact with cross functional teams (tax, source-to-pay, Fixed Assets, Consolidations, International) on project plans to gather cross-functional requirements.
Partner with Finance leaders to deliver change management to ensure new processes and technology are deployed effectively and adopted by the organization.

Title: Sr. Manager/ Principal Data Analyst - Risk
FullDescriptions:
About Earnin:
Every year, while Americans wait for their paychecks, more than $1 trillion of their hard-earned money is held up in the pay cycle. As a result, we accumulate over $50 billion in late and overdraft fees and turn to high-interest loans. Overdraft charges and bank fees often trap people in a cycle of debt that can lead to unhealthy decisions and falling victim to predatory businesses disguised as helpful services. We don't accept that.

Earnin is an app that creates products that help people gain control of their finances. Cash Out lets people get paid as soon as they leave work, with no fees, interest, or hidden costs. With Health Aid, Earnin negotiates on behalf of community members to lower their total unpaid medical bill and work out a budget-friendly payment plan. Cash Back Rewards is a way for members to earn up to 10% cash back on purchases from over a thousand local and national businesses without needing a credit card or having to reach spend thresholds to earn cash rewards — and they can withdraw the money at any time. We also offer free tools to help avoid overdrafts, to remind people when recurring bills are due, and we're working on more! There is never any required cost to use any of these products or services, users can choose to tip what they think is fair to support the service and pay it forward to keep the movement going.

Earnin is supported by funding partners including Andreessen Horowitz, Matrix Partners, Ribbit Capital, Felicis Venture, Thrive Capital, and others. Join us and help build a new financial system focused on fairness and people's needs.

You can help make a difference.

About the Team:
Business decisions at Earnin rely heavily on good analysis. Autonomous, cross-functional product and operational teams (we call them "pods") drive these decisions on a day to day basis. You'll help a group of pods make product decisions by providing them with insights from our data. For success in this role, you'll need to be comfortable diving deep into the data, owning your analysis, and communicating your insights in an accessible way.

The Risk Pod sits at the heart of Earnin. As the owners of the core business metrics, Risk powers the financial engine that allows Earnin to constantly deliver value to our community. Our Risk team has taken a unique approach to risk management, portfolio management, and interacting with our community members.

This position will give you ample opportunity to use and enhance your analytics skills and be hands-on with a complex product in an interesting market. We're in the process of building out our analytics capabilities, so you'll also have a chance to shape the methods and tools that we use. Our business has interesting characteristics for analysis, e.g. lack of a fixed price or term, heavy dependency on external events and providers, and a very data-rich environment. It also has a large and direct impact on the financial lives of its users.

This role has the potential for massive impact on Earnin's growth trajectory. If you have a passion for helping people and a background in data, we want to hear from you!

What Set Us Apart:

A mission to improve the financial lives of folks who need help
Exceptional product-market fit with NPS scores in the 80s
$185 million raised from top tier fintech investors
Great growth, unit economics and user acquisition costs

Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Integrated decision making in the business area considering broader economic P&L, brand and people impact
Ownership mindset managing portfolio with P&L accountability in the business segment
Drive step-change improvements in risk management performance by connecting drivers of future consumer needs to historical behavior, creating risk models, and testing hypotheses using rigorous monitoring and analysis
May manage and develop a team of analysts. Coaching and mentoring analysts to develop and retain talent
Ability to execute decisions in an uncertain and fluid environment
Provide colleagues with guidance in making product, marketing and operations decisions from an analytical perspective.
Lead business monitoring to have close visibility on key metrics
Work closely with data science team to improve risk models with business insights and past experience

Some skills we consider critical to being a Principal Data Analyst:


4+ years of quantitative analysis using data manipulation tools like SQL, R, Python
Ability to communicate statistical analysis and business analysis in well balanced way
Proven project experience where cross functional teams are involved
Expertise with data manipulation. An ideal candidate is comfortable joining/merging data sets with complex relationships and identifying and troubleshooting data issues. SQL, R, Python with pandas experience preferred, but extensive experience using SAS, Excel, etc is also possible.
Can identify and effectively prioritize opportunities to make our business better with analysis.
Experience with delivering information that solves product, marketing or operations questions.
Communicates metrics and data clearly and able to translate analytical insights to business metrics
Ability to apply statistics and probability concepts to split testing or LTV estimation
Works well in a time and resource constrained environment. Can prioritize, get things done on their own, but ask for help when needed.

In addition, we expect you to have or quickly develop:

Significant experience with R, python, git, schema creation
Data visualization with any of the following tools: Looker, Tableau, R/Python packages, matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.
Experience with 3rd party analytics services like Google Analytics, Amplitude, Braze
BS or Master's Degree, and relevant experience
Have 4+ years of relevant experience, preferably within a high-growth environment.

Earnin does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, legally protected medical condition, family care status, military or veteran status, marital status, registered domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal laws. Earnin is an E-Verify participant.
